metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9809 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
If the source for resources on a page is through an FTP connection, it is possible to trigger a series of modal alert messages for these resources through invalid credentials or locations. These messages cannot be immediately dismissed, allowing for a denial of service (DOS) attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-9809` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
